videoData.title: How we're turning carbon waste into jet fuel (and everything else)

learnModules.blurb: Learn how you can help cut the world's emissions in half by 2030, in the race to a zero-carbon world.
learnModules.headline: Countdown: A global initiative to accelerate solutions to the climate crisis

nodes.whoTheyAre: LanzaTech CEO Jennifer Holmgren envisions a post-pollution future where we can choose where our carbon comes from and keep virgin fossil carbon in the ground.
nodes.whyListen:
Jennifer Holmgren has spent much of her career doing things people said couldn't be done, like working on technologies to produce the first sustainable aviation fuels and creating a new way to source, use and dispose of carbon. At LanzaTech, Holmgren is working to use recycled carbon to create everything from apparel to carpets to laundry detergent and beyond. She has always believed in the importance of a sustainable future for all -- one where access to clean energy and sustainable goods isn't just for the wealthy.

 

"@TodaDogs 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/jennifer-holmgren-95b6201/ "

videoData.description: At LanzaTech, CEO Jennifer Holmgren and her team have engineered a unique technology that recycles carbon waste to create ethanol, which can then be used as a clean fuel for machines or industrial processes. In conversation with TED's head of curation Helen Walters, Holmgren explains how governments and independent institutions can turn emissions into something useful -- and shares advice for other disruptors looking to transform the clean energy industry.
videoData.socialDescription: At LanzaTech, CEO Jennifer Holmgren and her team have engineered a unique technology that recycles carbon waste to create ethanol, which can then be used as a clean fuel for machines or industrial processes. In conversation with TED's head of curation Helen Walters, Holmgren explains how governments and independent institutions can turn emissions into something useful -- and shares advice for other disruptors looking to transform the clean energy industry.
